samples.title: Auto load single video src
samples.description: The simplest means of using a dash.js player in a web page. The mpd src is specified within the @src attribute of the video element.

samples.title: Auto load single video
samples.description: The mpd source is specified within the child Source element of the video element.

samples.title: Auto load multi video
samples.description: This example shows how to auto-embed multiple instances of dash.js players in a page.

samples.title: Manual load single video
samples.description: A sample showing how to load a single video.

samples.title: Manual load with custom settings
samples.description: A sample showing how to load a video using custom settings.

samples.title: Using the Control Bar
samples.description: This example shows how to add and configure the Akamai control bar with dash.js player.

samples.title: Listening to events
samples.description: Example showing how to listen to events raised by dash.js.

samples.title: Log levels
samples.description: This examples shows how to configure dash.js logging levels.

samples.title: Live delay comparison custom manifest
samples.description: Example showing how to use the two MediaPlayer APIS which control live delay: setLiveDelay and setLiveDelayFragmentCount.

samples.title: Live delay comparison using fragment count
samples.description: Example showing the combined effects of segment duration and the setLiveDelayFragmentCount MediaPlayer method on the latency of live stream playback

samples.title: Live delay comparison using setLiveDelay
samples.description: Example showing the combined effects of segment duration and the setLiveDelay MediaPlayer method on the latency of live stream playback.

samples.title: Synchronized live playback with the catchup mode
samples.description: Example showing a synchronized live playback of two videos using the live playback catchup mode.

samples.title: Live stream with availabilityTimeOffset
samples.description: Example showing how dash.js handles live streams with an availabilityTimeOffset(ATO)

samples.title: Low latency
samples.description: Example showing how to use dash.js to play low latency streams.

samples.title: Low latency with L2ALL
samples.description: Example showing how to use dash.js to play low latency streams using the L2ALL ABR algorithm.

samples.title: Low latency with LoL+
samples.description: Example showing how to use dash.js to play low latency streams using the LoL+ ABR algorithm.

samples.title: Low latency with AAST based decisioning
samples.description: Example showing how to use dash.js to play very low latency streams using AAST based throughput calculation.

samples.title: Low latency testplayer
samples.description: Example showing how to use dash.js to play low latency streams. All related settings are adjustable.

samples.title: Changing the default ABR algorithm
samples.description: This example shows how configure the ABR algorithms in dash.js

samples.title: Custom ABR Rules
samples.description: Example showing how to create and define custom ABR rules in dash.js.

samples.title: Disable ABR
samples.description: Example showing how to disable the ABR switching in dash.js.

samples.title: Initial bitrate
samples.description: Example showing how to set the initial bitrate in dash.js.

samples.title: Max/min bitrate
samples.description: Example showing how to set the maximum and minimum bitrate in dash.js.

samples.title: Buffer target
samples.description: Example showing how to define the buffer targets in dash.js

samples.title: Buffer cleanup
samples.description: Example showing how to define the parameters for buffer cleanup/pruning in dash.js

samples.title: Initial buffer target
samples.description: Example showing how to define the initial buffer target at playback start in dash.js.

samples.title: Widevine
samples.description: This example shows how to use dash.js to play streams with Widevine DRM protection.

samples.title: PlayReady
samples.description: This example shows how to use dash.js to play streams with PlayReady DRM protection (Windows 10 Microsoft Chromium Edge only).

samples.title: ClearKey
samples.description: This example shows how to use dash.js to play streams with ClearKey protection.

samples.title: License wrapping
samples.description: This example shows how to use dash.js to filter and wrap license requests and responses

samples.title: Keysystem priority
samples.description: This example shows how to specify a DRM system priority in case the underlying platform supports multiple DRM systems.

samples.title: VoD Multiperiod
samples.description: Example showing how dash.js handles streams with two periods.

samples.title: Live Multiperiod
samples.description: Example showing how dash.js handles live streams with multiple periods.

samples.title: Caption VTT
samples.description: This example shows how content with VTT captions can be played back by the dash.js player. First captions appear at the 15s mark.

samples.title: CEA 608/708
samples.description: This example shows how content with embedded CEA 608/708 captions can be played back by the dash.js player.

samples.title: Multi Track Captions
samples.description: Example showing content with multiple timed text tracks.

samples.title: TTML EBU timed text tracks
samples.description: Example showing content with TTML EBU timed text tracks.

samples.title: Multiple audio tracks
samples.description: This example shows how content with multiple audio tracks can be played back by the dash.js player. dash.js allows a switch of the audio track during playback.

samples.title: Multiple audio tracks with different codecs
samples.description: This example shows how content with multiple audio tracks with different codecs can be played back by the dash.js player. dash.js allows a switch of the audio track during playback.

samples.title: Thumbnails
samples.description: Example showing how to use streams with thumbnails representations.

samples.title: Audio only stream
samples.description: This example shows how to play audio-only streams in dash.js.

samples.title: Monitoring the stream
samples.description: This example shows how to monitor metrics of the streams played by dash.js.

samples.title: Listening to SCTE-EMSG Events
samples.description: Example showing how to listen to SCTE EMSG events raised by dash.js.

samples.title: Autoplay Browser policy
samples.description: This sample shows how to deal with autoplay browsers policy. It uses an event listener to detect when auto playback is interrupted by the browser and how to recover from this situation muting audio.

samples.title: Extending Dash.js
samples.description: This sample shows how to use dash.js extend mechanism to add custom HTTP headers and modify URL's of the requests done by the player.

samples.title: CMCD Reporting
samples.description: This sample shows how to use dash.js in order to enhance requests to the CDN with Common Media Client Data (CMCD - CTA 5005).

samples.title: Custom Capabilities Filters
samples.description: This sample shows how to filter representations.

samples.title: Custom initial track selection example
samples.description: This sample shows how to define your own initial track selection function.

samples.title: Offline mode
samples.description: Example showing how store and read back streams without network connection to Dash

samples.title: Microsoft Smooth Streaming
samples.description: Example showing how to use dash.js to play Microsoft Smooth Streaming streams.

samples.title: Mediaplayer only
samples.description: A sample showing how to use the dash.mediaplayer bundle. This bundle does not contain any code for playback of DRM protected content.
